explore3d.behaviors
Class KeyNavigator

java.lang.Object
  javax.media.j3d.SceneGraphObject
      javax.media.j3d.Node
          javax.media.j3d.Leaf
              javax.media.j3d.Behavior
                  explore3d.behaviors.KeyNavigator

public class KeyNavigator
extends javax.media.j3d.Behavior

KeyNavigator class translates keyboard input to motion (also toggles certain behaviors in MouseLooker)

Author:
J.J. Molenaar, J. Dooper

Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize()
Set trigger conditions window need to be focused to accept keys (for example when rotate is selected the mainwindow is unfocused and wont accept input)

Specified by:
initialize in class javax.media.j3d.Behavior

processStimulus

public void processStimulus(java.util.Enumeration criteria)
Process stimuli 
 W/up  move forward
 S/dn  move back
 A/lf  move left
 D/rt  move right
 F       toggle mouse look
 R       toggle mouse look permanently

Specified by:
processStimulus in class javax.media.j3d.Behavior
Parameters:
criteria - Events

processKeyPress

private void processKeyPress(java.awt.event.KeyEvent event)
Process key press event z = slow speed x = normal speed c = fast speed q = up e = down since collision detection is active the buttons q and e won't work.

Parameters:
event - Event parameters, only used for scancode of key

canMove

private boolean canMove(javax.vecmath.Vector3d direction)
Detect if view location can be moved in a direction collision detection with picktool.

Parameters:
direction -
Returns:
true if the move does not cause a colission
